head.title: The Pope Sends A Message to China

hedline.hl1: The Pope Sends A Message to China

block.p: Pope John Paul II canonized 87 Chinese believers and 33 European missionaries killed in China between 1648 and 1930, and it was clear that he wanted to send a message to those Chinese Catholics who remain loyal to Rome and are often persecuted. The Chinese government reacted fiercely, described the Vatican's martyrs as imperialist spies and ''evil-doing sinners.'' The pope said he did not seek to make judgments about history, but that did not appease Beijing, which warned that the Vatican's quest to normalize relations had been severely hampered.
